bill.constitutionalAuthorityStatementText: [Congressional Record Volume 166, Number 193 (Thursday, November 12, 2020)][House]From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]By Mr. FOSTER:H.R. 8740.Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuantto the following:This bill is enacted pursuant to the power granted toCongress under Article I, Section 8, Clauses 1 and 18 of theUnited States Constitution.[Page H5731]

item.text: Referred to the House Committee on Financial Services.

summary.text:
Strengthening Cybersecurity for the Financial Sector Act of 2020

This bill requires a Federal Home Loan Bank or government-sponsored enterprise to notify the Federal Housing Finance Agency of any services performed off its premises. The performance of these services is subject to regulation and examination. The bill also applies to credit unions existing limitations regarding investments by depository institutions in a bank service company.

bill.title: Strengthening Cybersecurity for the Financial Sector Act of 2020

item.title: Strengthening Cybersecurity for the Financial Sector Act of 2020
Strengthening Cybersecurity for the Financial Sector Act of 2020

To amend the Bank Service Company Act to cover credit unions to the same extent as such Act covers banks and savings associations, to provide the Director of the Federal Housing Finance Agency with the authority to regulate the provision of services provided to the Government-sponsored enterprises and Federal Home Loan Banks, and for other purposes.

latestAction.text: Referred to the House Committee on Financial Services.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
